alert.note: Alert for Little River; Sevier (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 5:06AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Little River, southern Sevier and southeastern McCurtain Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 505 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arkinda, or 8 miles northwest of Foreman, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ashdown, Foreman, Idabel, Wilton, Winthrop, Ogden, Ben Lomond, Arkinda, Richmond, Haworth, Bokhoma, Moon, Cerrogordo, Harris, Goodwater, Shinewell, Wallace, Tom, Arden and America. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
